user_stories.title: As a strategy developer, I want to define strategy parameters and logic so that I can create new trading strategies.
user_stories.description: This story describes the need for a mechanism to define the input parameters (e.g., symbols, timeframes, indicators) and the core execution logic (e.g., buy/sell conditions, stop-loss, take-profit) for a trading strategy within the system.
acceptance_criteria: The system can store strategy names and descriptions.
The system can store a structured representation of strategy parameters (e.g., JSON, YAML schema).
The system can store strategy execution logic (e.g., rule-based conditions, algorithm reference).
A strategy can be associated with an owner or creator.

tasks.title: Design Strategy Data Model
tasks.description: Define the database schema for core strategy attributes, parameters, and logic structure.

tasks.title: Implement Strategy Model Entity
tasks.description: Create the ORM entity (e.g., Java POJO, Python class) representing a trading strategy.

tasks.title: Develop Strategy Creation API Endpoint
tasks.description: Implement a REST API endpoint for submitting new strategy definitions to the backend.

tasks.title: Add Validation for Strategy Parameters
tasks.description: Implement server-side validation for mandatory fields and data types of strategy parameters.

user_stories.title: As a strategy manager, I want to save a trading strategy to the database so that it can be retrieved and used later.
user_stories.description: This story covers the persistence aspect of the trading strategy, ensuring that once a strategy is defined, it can be reliably stored and retrieved from the database.
acceptance_criteria: A newly created strategy can be successfully saved to the database.
An existing strategy can be retrieved by its unique identifier.
The saved strategy retains all defined parameters and logic upon retrieval.
Database constraints prevent duplicate strategy names for a given user.

tasks.title: Implement Strategy Repository (DAO)
tasks.description: Develop the data access layer for creating, reading, updating, and deleting strategy records.

tasks.title: Integrate Persistence Layer with Service
tasks.description: Connect the repository to the strategy management service for save and retrieve operations.

tasks.title: Write Unit Tests for Persistence Operations
tasks.description: Create tests to verify successful saving, retrieval, and error handling of strategy data.

tasks.title: Configure Database Connection
tasks.description: Set up database connection pools and ORM configuration for strategy persistence.

user_stories.title: As a backend developer, I want to ensure the strategy data model is version-controlled so that schema changes can be managed effectively.
user_stories.description: This is a technical story focusing on the maintenance and evolution of the strategy data model. It requires a mechanism to manage schema migrations as the strategy definition evolves.
acceptance_criteria: Database schema migrations can be applied automatically or manually.
Previous versions of the schema are supported or clearly deprecated.
Migration scripts are stored in version control.
Backward compatibility is maintained where possible during schema upgrades.

tasks.title: Select Database Migration Tool
tasks.description: Choose a suitable tool like Flyway or Liquibase for managing database schema changes.

tasks.title: Implement Initial Schema Migration Script
tasks.description: Create the first migration script to establish the base strategy table and its columns.

tasks.title: Configure Migration Tool in Project
tasks.description: Integrate the chosen migration tool into the project's build and deployment process.

tasks.title: Document Schema Change Process
tasks.description: Write documentation on how to create, test, and deploy new schema migrations.
